title: Acorn Bank Walk Route

images.title: David Hambidge / CC BY-SA (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0)
images.caption: Water Mill at Acorn Bank. View from beck-side deciduous wood to partially restored water mill with mill race behind black fence.

images.title: Mick Garratt / The Herb Garden and Dovecote, Acorn Bank
images.caption: The Herb Garden and Dovecote, Acorn Bank

images.title: Mick Garratt / Fields, Acorn Bank
images.caption: Fields, Acorn Bank. With Temple Sowerby in the distance.

images.title: David Hambidge / CC BY-SA (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0)
images.caption: Snowdrop carpet. View across snowdrop carpet to Crowdundle Beck at Acorn Bank. These flowers are a lovely feature during January and February at the park.

images.title: Alan Murray-Rust / Footpath onto the old railway at Acorn Bank
images.caption: Footpath onto the old railway at Acorn Bank. The railway will become the route of the proposed tramway extension to Clifton. The embankment will be removed, with the tram running at ground level. A new bridge or culvert over the land drain will be required to replace the one visible here.

images.title: Crowdundle Beck at Acorn Bank by Carol Walker, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Crowdundle Beck. A nice waterside footpath on the site.

images.title: Culgaith, war memorial by Bikeboy, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Culgaith, war memorial. A view of the village north of the site.

description: This walk takes you through the National Trust owned Acorn Bank Gardens and into the surrounding countryside to the village of Culgaith in the Eden District of Cumbria. Acorn Bank has stunning gardens with orchards carpeted with wildflowers and surrounded by herbaceous borders. You can also visit the restored 19th century watermill and enjoy a stroll along Crowdundle Beck. The site is located close to Penrith in Cumbria. You can extend your walk by picking up the waterside footpath along the River Eden and heading south towards Temple Sowerby. Also nearby is Whinfell Forest and Cliburn Moss Nature Reserve. The forest and reserve are located just a couple of miles away and provide a good opportunity to extend your walking in the Eden District.
